abstract: ESPN, which dominates sports on television, is collaborating with Creative Artists Agency and Walt Disney Studios to produce and distribute theatrical films, Brooks Barnes reports in Monday’s New York Times. The network “is also hiring 30 filmmakers to produce one-hour mini-movies to appear on the channel starting in September 2009.”
lead_paragraph: ESPN, which dominates sports on television, is collaborating with Creative Artists Agency and Walt Disney Studios to produce and distribute theatrical films, Brooks Barnes reports in Monday’s New York Times. The network “is also hiring 30 filmmakers to produce one-hour mini-movies to appear on the channel starting in September 2009.”
